column4: Hi, I'm running Lucid on an eeePC 1000, and I can't seem to get nm-applet to authenticate with a WPA2 protected wireless network.  What steps can I take to troubleshoot?
got any error msg? checked dmesg? var/log/messages?
I'm not sure how to check that, but I'll look in v/l/m
just open with less and jump to the end, see if there's anything suspicious there. same with dmesg | less
kk, will do
http://paste.ubuntu.com/480648/
doesnt look too odd. didi it work before? on another OS/distro/version? what hardware you got? what happens when you try to connect?
I just resuscitated this laptop, but WPA worked back in June
so - what happens when you try to connect?
it tries and tries and tries and then spits me back to a password prompt.  I've re-typed the password, and copy-pasted it from the router's config, so I'm pretty confident
does the network manager *see* your wifi net?
yes, sorry if I'm being unclear
what router you got?
Belkin Wireless N, it works with other peoples' mac and windows computers
MAC filter on the router?
sorry, missed that last one, saw it as I hit quit
don't think so.  I'm not going to be able to get to another network soon, sadly
if all else fails you could give wireshark a shot and see what's what... that's voodoo then, tho
wireshark?
if you never heard of it, you don't wanna go there, really :)
so where else should I take my problem?

well.. next steps are ruling out culprits. so: test eee on another wifi, if that's succesful check out the router. if you have access to it try temporarily disabling encryption and other security measures
maybe the folks from aircrack-ng can help, they have a channel here. they're surprisingly friendly towards "normal" people :D
then again - install wireshark, run as root and see if you can make somethign useful of it. perhaps googling specific functions helps.
